metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4046 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In some circumstances, a stale value could have been used for a global variable in WASM JIT analysis. This resulted in incorrect compilation and a potentially exploitable crash in the content process. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, and Firefox ESR < 115.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4046` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.15.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '102.15.1-1').
thunderbird package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
